Window and Display.label: Fullscreen Mode
Window and Display.description: Forces the game to launch in fullscreen.

Window and Display.label: Windowed Mode (-windowed)
Window and Display.description: Forces the game into a windowed state.

Window and Display.label: Windowed Mode (-sw)
Window and Display.description: Alias for -windowed. Forces the engine to start in windowed mode.

Window and Display.label: Remove Window Border
Window and Display.description: Removes window borders if windowed mode is used.

Window and Display.label: Window Width
Window and Display.description: Sets a custom width for the window.

Window and Display.label: Window Height
Window and Display.description: Sets a custom height for the window.

Window and Display.label: Disable Intro Videos (-novideo)
Window and Display.description: Alias for -novid. Skips opening video sequences.

Performance.label: High Priority
Performance.description: Launches the game in high CPU priority mode.

Performance.label: Disable Joystick
Performance.description: Disables joystick support for increased performance.

Performance.label: Heap Size (KB)
Performance.description: Specifies the heapsize (in kilobytes) the game will use.

Rendering API.label: Force DirectX Level
Rendering API.description: Forces a specific DirectX version (example values: 80, 81, 90, 95, 98). Warning: DirectX 7 (70) is unsupported and may cause crashes.

Proton & DXVK.label: DXVK HUD
Proton & DXVK.description: Enable DXVK HUD overlay (example: "fps,memory,version,api"). Set as an environment variable before %command%: DXVK_HUD="fps,memory".

Proton & DXVK.label: DXVK Log Level
Proton & DXVK.description: Set DXVK logging level (none, error, warn, info, debug) or numeric value. Example: DXVK_LOG_LEVEL=info

Proton & DXVK.label: DXVK Config File
Proton & DXVK.description: Point to a DXVK config file. Example: DXVK_CONFIG_FILE=/path/to/dxvk.conf

Proton & DXVK.label: DXVK Frame Rate
Proton & DXVK.description: Limit the frame rate via DXVK. Example: DXVK_FRAME_RATE=60

Proton & DXVK.label: DXVK Async
Proton & DXVK.description: Enable asynchronous command submission (may improve performance on some GPUs). Example: DXVK_ASYNC=1

Proton & DXVK.label: DXVK Async Flip
Proton & DXVK.description: Enable async flip optimization. Example: DXVK_ASYNC_FLIP=1

Proton & DXVK.label: DXVK State Cache
Proton & DXVK.description: Enable DXVK state cache to speed up shader/state creation. Example: DXVK_STATE_CACHE=1

Proton & DXVK.label: DXVK Filter Device Names
Proton & DXVK.description: Filter which GPUs DXVK will use by name (comma-separated). Example: DXVK_FILTER_DEVICE_NAMES="NVIDIA"

Proton & DXVK.label: DXVK Filter Device Vendor IDs
Proton & DXVK.description: Filter GPUs by vendor ID (comma-separated). Example: DXVK_FILTER_DEVICE_VENDOR_IDS=0x10de

Proton & DXVK.label: DXVK Filter Device IDs
Proton & DXVK.description: Filter GPUs by device ID (comma-separated). Example: DXVK_FILTER_DEVICE_IDS=0x1c82

Proton & DXVK.label: VKD3D Config File
Proton & DXVK.description: Point to a VKD3D config file. Example: VKD3D_CONFIG_FILE=/path/to/vkd3d.conf

Proton & DXVK.label: VKD3D Log Level
Proton & DXVK.description: Set VKD3D logging level (none, error, warn, info, debug). Example: VKD3D_LOG_LEVEL=info

Proton & DXVK.label: PROTON DLSS Upgrade
Proton & DXVK.description: Automatically upgrade DLSS to the latest version (set to 1). Example: PROTON_DLSS_UPGRADE=1

Proton & DXVK.label: PROTON DLSS Indicator
Proton & DXVK.description: Show DLSS status indicator in-game (set to 1). Example: PROTON_DLSS_INDICATOR=1

Proton & DXVK.label: PROTON NVIDIA Libs
Proton & DXVK.description: Enable Nvidia libraries (PhysX, CUDA) when needed. Example: PROTON_NVIDIA_LIBS=1

Proton & DXVK.label: PROTON FSR4 Upgrade
Proton & DXVK.description: Automatically upgrade FSR4 to the latest version (set to 1). Example: PROTON_FSR4_UPGRADE=1

Proton & DXVK.label: PROTON FSR4 RDNA3 Upgrade
Proton & DXVK.description: Use RDNA3-optimized FSR4 DLL (set to 1). Example: PROTON_FSR4_RDNA3_UPGRADE=1

Proton & DXVK.label: PROTON XeSS Upgrade
Proton & DXVK.description: Automatically upgrade XeSS to the latest version (set to 1). Example: PROTON_XESS_UPGRADE=1

Proton & DXVK.label: PROTON Log
Proton & DXVK.description: Enable Proton logging. Example: PROTON_LOG=1

Proton & DXVK.label: PROTON Enable HDR
Proton & DXVK.description: Enable HDR support in Proton-based runtimes. Example: PROTON_ENABLE_HDR=1

Proton & DXVK.label: Skip GL Shader Disk Cache Cleanup
Proton & DXVK.description: Prevent automatic cleanup of GL shader disk cache. Example: __GL_SHADER_DISK_CACHE_SKIP_CLEANUP=1

Proton & DXVK.label: GL Shader Disk Cache Size
Proton & DXVK.description: Increase the maximum shader cache size (bytes). Example: __GL_SHADER_DISK_CACHE_SIZE=12000000000

Proton & DXVK.label: LD_PRELOAD
Proton & DXVK.description: Set LD_PRELOAD to change preload libraries (example: LD_PRELOAD="" to disable Steam overlay).

Proton & DXVK.label: Enable DXVK D3D8 Support
Proton & DXVK.description: Enable DXVK D3D8 runtime support in Proton (set to 1). Example: PROTON_DXVK_D3D8=1

Networking.label: Force TCP
Networking.description: Uses the TCP protocol instead of UDP.

Debug and Console.label: Enable Console
Debug and Console.description: Opens the developer console on launch.

Debug and Console.label: Console Logging
Debug and Console.description: Logs all console output into the console.log text file.

Debug and Console.label: Developer Mode
Debug and Console.description: Enables developer mode: disables menu background maps and skips quit dialog on exit.

Debug and Console.label: Start in Console
Debug and Console.description: Starts the engine directly in the console unless a map is specified with +map.

Debug and Console.label: Execute Config File
Debug and Console.description: Executes a config file, example: autoexec.cfg

Misc.label: Disable Preload
Misc.description: Prevents the engine from preloading resources.

Misc.label: Autoconfig
Misc.description: Restores video and performance settings to defaults for the detected hardware and ignores .cfg files until removed.

Misc.label: Suppress Crash Dialogs
Misc.description: Suppresses native crash dialogs for unhandled memory errors.

Misc.label: Low Violence (Left 4 Dead)
Misc.description: Enables low violence options in Left 4 Dead.

Misc.label: Low Violence (Team Fortress 2)
Misc.description: Enables low violence (silly gibs) for Team Fortress 2.
